Posts.Content: bradswife wrote: I have completed 13 of 33 treatments -- external breast radiation.  The first week (after just a few days) I noticed a pain in my arm on the treated side.  It felt like a sore muscle on the inside of my forarm.  Last week (week #2), it got worse and is now the whole length of my arm and is affecting my range of motion -- it really hurts to reach up in a cabinet or out to the side.  The radiation oncologist is baffled and said this is not a usual side effect of radiation.  I had an ultrasound on my veins and muscles in that arm to day and all is normal.  I was FINE after surgery -- I did arm exercises and my range of motion was fine before radiation began.  Has anyone else had arm pain that they think is related to radiation?  I'd love to hear from you... Posts.Content: Feb 28, 2009 04:55PM bradswife wrote: I am on treatment #19 of 25 to the whole breast and have had little skin issues so far -- just redness and itching which calms down over the weekends.  I faithfully put on the prescription cream the doctor gave me (RadiaGel -- I think is the name).  I also use 100% aloe vera at least twice a day (more if needed for redness).  And I am using 1% hydrocortizone for the itching -- honestly, I think the aloe works the best for itching! My doctor told me since my breasts are small, I shouldn't have as many problems as women with larger breasts.  I have also read that if you have more "folds and creases" (as in underneath larger breasts), you have more issues too.
